title: Welcome to Permanent Mission of India in Geneva

quotes: Amandeep Singh Gill is India’s Ambassador and Permanent Representative to the Conference on Disarmament in Geneva since November 2016.
He joined the Indian Foreign Service in 1992.
He served as the Head of the Disarmament and International Security Division in the Ministry of External Affairs from 2013 until 2016.
He participated in the UN Disarmament Fellowship Programme in 1999.
During 2008-2009, he was a visiting scholar at Stanford University’s Center for International Security and Cooperation (CISAC) on an Asia Foundation regional security studies fellowship.
Amandeep Gill was born in 1968 in

organizations.name: Indian Mission to the UN in Geneva

quotes: At headquarters in New Delhi, he has served thrice in the Disarmament and International Security Affairs Division as well as once in the United Nations Division.

organizations.name: UN Secretary General’s panel of experts
quotes: He has also served as an expert on the UN Secretary General’s panel of experts on the Fissile Material Cut-off Treaty (FMCT), Small Arms and Light Weapons and on Missiles.

organizations.name: CCW Group of Governmental Experts on Lethal Autonomous Weapons Systems
quotes: He is currently Chair of the CCW Group of Governmental Experts on Lethal Autonomous Weapons Systems.

organizations.name: UNSG’s Advisory Board on Disarmament Matters
quotes: He is a member of the UNSG’s Advisory Board on Disarmament Matters.

organizations.name: Punjab University, Chandigarh
quotes: Amandeep Gill has a B Tech in engineering from Punjab University, Chandigarh and an Advanced Diploma in French History and Language from Geneva University.

organizations.name: Department of War Studies in King’s College, London
quotes: His PhD degree at the Department of War Studies in King’s College, London is on Nuclear Learning in Multilateral Forums.

organizations.name: Bulletin of Atomic Scientists
quotes: As a scholar he has contributed to the Bulletin of Atomic Scientists, the Lowy Institute, the East West Institute, the Center for a New American Security and the Indian Economic and Social History Review.

Welcome to Permanent Mission of India in Geneva
Amandeep Singh Gill is India’s Ambassador and Permanent Representative to the Conference on Disarmament in Geneva since November 2016.
Indian Mission to the Conference on Disarmament in Geneva
At headquarters in New Delhi, he has served thrice in the Disarmament and International Security Affairs Division as well as once in the United Nations Division.

Amandeep Gill has served abroad at the Indian Mission to the Conference on Disarmament in Geneva, the Indian Embassy in Tehran, the High Commission of India in Colombo and the Indian Mission to the UN in Geneva.

Amandeep Gill has served abroad at the Indian Mission to the Conference on Disarmament in Geneva, the Indian Embassy in Tehran, the High Commission of India in Colombo and the Indian Mission to the UN in Geneva.
Amandeep Gill has a B Tech in engineering from Punjab University, Chandigarh and an Advanced Diploma in French History and Language from Geneva University.
His PhD degree at the Department of War Studies in King’s College, London is on Nuclear Learning in Multilateral Forums.
